com.zhuinden.simplestack

Class BackstackDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zhuinden.simplestack.BackstackDelegate

  • public class BackstackDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
    A delegate class that manages the Backstack's Activity lifecycle integration, and provides view-state persistence for custom views that are associated with a key using KeyContextWrapper. This should be used in Activities to make sure that the Backstack survives both configuration changes and process death.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BackstackDelegate.NonConfigurationInstance
      The class which stores the BackstackManager for surviving configuration change.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackstackDelegate

        public BackstackDelegate(StateChanger stateChanger)
        Creates the BackstackDelegate. If StateChanger is null, then the initialize StateChange is postponed until it is explicitly set. The StateChanger must be set at some point before onPostResume().
        Parameters:
        stateChanger - The StateChanger to be set. Allowed to be null at initialization.

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyFilter

        public void setKeyFilter(KeyFilter keyFilter)
        Specifies a custom KeyFilter, allowing keys to be filtered out if they should not be restored after process death. If used, this method must be called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList).
        Parameters:
        keyFilter - The custom KeyFilter.

      • setKeyParceler

        public void setKeyParceler(KeyParceler keyParceler)
        Specifies a custom KeyParceler, allowing key parcellation strategies to be used for turning a key into Parcelable. If used, this method must be called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList).
        Parameters:
        keyParceler - The custom KeyParceler.

      • setStateClearStrategy

        public void setStateClearStrategy(BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy stateClearStrategy)
        Specifies a custom BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy, allowing a custom way of retaining saved state. The DefaultStateClearStrategy clears saved state for keys not found in the new state. If used, this method must be called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList).
        Parameters:
        stateClearStrategy - The custom BackstackManager.StateClearStrategy.

      • addStateChangeCompletionListener

        public void addStateChangeCompletionListener(Backstack.CompletionListener stateChangeCompletionListener)
        Adds a Backstack.CompletionListener, which will be added to the Backstack when it is initialized. As it is added only on initialization, these are added to the Backstack only once. Please note that this should not be an anonymous inner class, because this is kept across configuration changes. This can only be called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList).
        Parameters:
        stateChangeCompletionListener - the state change completion listener

      • setPersistenceTag

        public void setPersistenceTag(java.lang.String persistenceTag)
        Persistence tag allows you to have multiple BackstackDelegates in the same activity. This is required to make sure that the Backstack states do not overwrite each other in the saved instance state bundle. If used, this method must be called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList). A persistence tag can only be set once on a given BackstackDelegate instance.
        Parameters:
        persistenceTag - a non-null persistence tag that uniquely identifies this BackstackDelegate inside the Activity.

      • registerForLifecycleCallbacks

        public void registerForLifecycleCallbacks(android.app.Activity activity)
        Convenience method that automatically handles calling the following methods: - onPostResume() - onPause() - onSaveInstanceState(Bundle) - onDestroy(). This method can only be called after onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList). Note: This method cannot handle onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance(), so that must still be called manually.
        Parameters:
        activity - the Activity whose callbacks we register for.

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState,
                     java.lang.Object nonConfigurationInstance,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> initialKeys)
        The onCreate() delegate for the Activity. It initializes the backstack from either the non-configuration instance, the saved state, or creates a new one. Restores the SavedState that belongs to persisted view state. Begins an initialize StateChange if the StateChanger is set.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The Activity saved instance state bundle.
        nonConfigurationInstance - The BackstackDelegate.NonConfigurationInstance that is typically obtained with getLastCustomNonConfigurationInstance().
        initialKeys - A list of the keys that are used to set as initial history of the backstack.

      • setStateChanger

        public void setStateChanger(StateChanger stateChanger)
        Sets the StateChanger to the Backstack. Removes the previous one if it there was already one set. This call begins an initialize StateChange.
        Parameters:
        stateChanger - The StateChanger to be set.

      • onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance

        public BackstackDelegate.NonConfigurationInstance onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance()
        The onRetainCustomNonConfigurationInstance() delegate for the Activity. This is required to make sure that the Backstack survives configuration change.
        Returns:
        a BackstackDelegate.NonConfigurationInstance that contains the internal BackstackManager.

      • onBackPressed

        public boolean onBackPressed()
        The onBackPressed() delegate for the Activity. The call is delegated to Backstack.goBack()'.
        Returns:
        true if the Backstack handled the back press

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle outState)
        The onSaveInstanceState() delegate for the Activity. This is required in order to save the Backstack and the SavedState persisted with persistViewToState(View) into the Activity saved instance state bundle.
        Parameters:
        outState - the Bundle into which the backstack history and view states are saved.

      • onPostResume

        public void onPostResume()
        The onPostResume() delegate for the Activity. It re-attaches the StateChanger if it is not already set.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        The onPause() delegate for the Activity. It removes the StateChanger if it is set.

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        The onDestroy() delegate for the Activity. Forces any pending state change to execute with Backstack.executePendingStateChange().

      • getBackstack

        public Backstack getBackstack()
        Returns the Backstack that belongs to this delegate. This method can only be invoked after onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList) has been called.
        Returns:
        the Backstack managed by this delegate.

      • persistViewToState

        public void persistViewToState(android.view.View view)
        Provides the means to save the provided view's hierarchy state, and its optional StateBundle via Bundleable into a SavedState.
        Parameters:
        view - the view that belongs to a certain key

      • restoreViewFromState

        public void restoreViewFromState(android.view.View view)
        Restores the state of the view based on the currently stored SavedState, according to the view's key.
        Parameters:
        view - the view that belongs to a certain key

      • getSavedState

        public SavedState getSavedState(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns a SavedState instance for the given key. If the state does not exist, then a new associated state is created.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to which the SavedState belongs.
        Returns:
        the saved state that belongs to the given key.

      • getManager

        public BackstackManager getManager()
        Returns the BackstackManager. If called before onCreate(Bundle, Object, ArrayList), it throws an exception.
        Returns:
        the backstack manager
